title: Gemini 3 Pro vs AutoGen: Which AI Tool is Better in 2025?
metaDescription: Compare Gemini 3 Pro vs AutoGen. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best AI tool for your needs in 2025.
introduction: Choosing between Gemini 3 Pro and AutoGen? These AI tools serve different but sometimes overlapping purposes, each with unique strengths. This comparison breaks down the key differences to help you decide.

sections.title: Overview: Gemini 3 Pro vs AutoGen
paragraphs: Gemini 3 Pro (llms) is Gemini 3 Pro is Google's latest flagship AI model, launched in 2025 with groundbreaking multimodal capabilities. It achieves a 76.2% score on SWE-bench Verified (surpassing Claude Sonnet 4.5's 70%), features a 1M token context window with 64K output, and uniquely offers full native video processing alongside text and images. Its key differentiator is best-in-class reasoning combined with true multimodal understanding including video, making it ideal for complex analysis and agentic workflows.. It's known for llm, multimodal, video-understanding.

AutoGen (workflow automation) is AutoGen is an open-source framework from Microsoft Research for building and orchestrating multi-agent AI systems. It enables developers to create, manage, and coordinate multiple conversational AI agents—each with specialized roles, capabilities, and tools—to collaboratively solve complex tasks through structured dialogue. Its unique value lies in its flexible, code-centric approach to agent definition and its seamless integration with human oversight, making it a powerful tool for automating intricate workflows that require reasoning, tool use, and iterative problem-solving.. Users choose it for multi-agent-systems, conversational-ai, workflow-automation.

sections.title: Key Features
paragraphs: Gemini 3 Pro: 76.2% SWE-bench Verified score (highest available), 1M token context window with 64K output, Native video processing (unique among all models)

AutoGen: Customizable, conversable agent programming with adjustable LLM backends (OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.), Built-in support for role-based agent patterns (e.g., Assistant, UserProxy, GroupChat) with customizable system prompts, Seamless code execution, debugging, and human-in-the-loop feedback within agent conversations

verdict: Both Gemini 3 Pro and AutoGen are excellent AI tools. Your choice depends on specific needs: Gemini 3 Pro for llm, AutoGen for multi-agent-systems.
